name: Island Child
description:
Grave found in the fishermen's cemetery on Honey Island

Ilha do Mel (Honey Island) is located in the South Atlantic Ocean and lies 15 miles from the Port of Paranaguá, with its closest point to the continent being 4 km from Pontal do Sul, in the municipality of Pontal do Paraná, on the coast of the state of Paraná, Brazil, known since the 17th century.  In the 19th century it was used as a breeding island for slaves and also for the disposal of prisoners. Today it has an exclusively tourist function.

Very small tombstone, does not have much information, only the date of death and the name, everything indicates that it is of a little girl, due to the small size of the tombstone and also the dolls that were left as offerings on top of the grave.

photogrammetry scan - 2022 Higor Casagrande
